Alignment tools¶

Arthur Zwaenepoel - 2017

Alignment related tools.

Contribution note: It is trivial to add support for another aligner (besides MUSCLE and PRANK). Especially when it’s for amino acid alignments (codon alignment as PRANK are a bit more involved). To add another aligner, only the MSA.run_aligner() method should be modified to include the aligner of interest.

class wgd.alignment.MSA(muscle='muscle', prank='prank', tmp='./')¶

Multiple multiple sequence alignment (MSA) programs python wrappers. Currently only runs with default settings.

Usage examples

  • Sequences in dictionary, output as dictionary:

    >>> MSA().run_aligner({'bear_gene': 'BEARBEAR', 'hare_gene': 'HAREERAH', 'yeast_gene': 'BEERBEARBEER'})
{'bear_gene': '----BEARBEAR-',
'hare_gene': '-----HAREERAH',
'yeast_gene': 'BEERBEARBEER-'}

  • Sequences in fasta file, output as fasta file (msa.fasta):

    >>> msa = MSA()
>>> msa.run_aligner('./sequences.fasta', './msa.fasta')
__init__(muscle='muscle', prank='prank', tmp='./')¶

Muscle wrapper init.

Parameters:
  • muscle – path to Muscle executable, will by defult look for Muscle in the system PATH
  • prank – path to PRANK executable
  • tmp – directory to store temporary files.
run_aligner(sequences, aligner='muscle', file=None)¶

Run MSA on sequences stored in dictionary with a particular aligner

Parameters:
  • sequences – dictionary of sequences or input fasta file
  • file – output file name, if not provided output is dictionary
  • aligner – alignment software to use (prank|muscle)
Returns:

MSA file
wgd.alignment._nucleotide_msa_from_protein_msa(protein_msa_sequences, nucleotide_sequences)¶

Make a nucleotide multiple sequence alignment from a protein multiple sequence alignment

Parameters:
  • protein_msa_sequences – dictionary with protein sequences (aligned)
  • nucleotide_sequences – dictionary with nucleotide sequences (unaligned)
Returns:

dictionary with nucleotide sequences (aligned)
wgd.alignment._strip_gaps(msa_dict)¶

Strip gap positions from a multiple sequence alignment (MSA). Finds the positions in the strings that have a gap and removes them in all sequences.

Parameters:msa_dict – dictionary with aligned nucleotide sequences.
wgd.alignment.hamming_distance(s1, s2)¶

Return the Hamming distance between equal-length sequences

wgd.alignment.multiple_sequence_aligment_nucleotide(msa_protein, nucleotide_sequences, min_length=100, aligner='muscle')¶

Make a nucleotide multiple sequence alignment based on a protein alignment

Parameters:
  • msa_protein – dictionary of aligned protein sequences
  • nucleotide_sequences – nucleotide sequence dictionary
  • min_length – minimum alignment length to consider
  • aligner – alignment program used, if prank, than msa_protein will be interpreted as codon alignment
Returns:

nucleotide MSA, length, stripped length
wgd.alignment.pairwise_alignment_stats(msa)¶

Get pairwise stats from MSA. Return as dictionary {Gene1: {Gene2: [0.8, 0.7], Gene3: [...], ...}

Parameters:msa – MSA dictionary
Returns:dictionary
